de.unlixx.runpng

Class AppFileManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.unlixx.runpng.AppFileManager

  • public class AppFileManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements an AppFileManager used for file handling and user interaction.

      • isProject

        boolean isProject()
        Checks whether a project is currently loaded.
        Returns:
        True if there is a project loaded.

      • getFilename

        java.lang.String getFilename()
        Gets the filename (without extension) of the currently active file.
        Returns:
        A string containing the filename. Or the localized unnamed name if there is no file actually.

      • getProjectFilename

        java.lang.String getProjectFilename()
        Gets the filename (without extension) of the currently active project file.
        Returns:
        A string containing the filename of the current project file. Or the normal filename if there is no project file actually.

      • doFileNew

        void doFileNew()
        Resets the actual files to null.

      • haveProject

        boolean haveProject()
        Checks whether there is a project file loaded.
        Returns:
        True if there is a project file loaded.

      • getPathFromPrefs

        java.lang.String getPathFromPrefs(java.lang.String... astrKeys)
        Gets the most recently file path from the preferences store.
        Parameters:
        astrKeys - A variable args list of strings containing the preference keys.
        Returns:
        A string with a path. Or null if none has been stored yet.

      • saveProjectFile

        void saveProjectFile(java.io.File file)
        Collects the current content in a PngProject object, starts a Progress task and returns. The Progress task saves the project autonomously in a GUI independent thread to the given file. If an error occurs then the user will be informed with a message box.
        Parameters:
        file - The File to save the PngProject content.

      • onSaveProjectFileAs

        boolean onSaveProjectFileAs()
        Shows a save dialog to the user and starts a project save.
        Returns:
        True if the saving has been started. False if the user cancelled it.

      • onSaveProjectFile

        void onSaveProjectFile()
        Saves the current project content if there is already a known file. If not then the file needs to be saved with user interaction.

      • savePngFile

        void savePngFile(java.io.File file,
                 Bitmap32Sequence sequence,
                 boolean bSetClean)
        Optimizes the given Bitmap32Sequence for saving, starts a Progress task and returns. The Progress task saves the sequence autonomously in a GUI independent thread to the given file. If an error occurs then the user will be informed with a message box.
        Parameters:
        file - The File to save the Bitmap32Sequence.
        sequence - A Bitmap32Sequence object.
        bSetClean - If true then the "clean" flag shall be set in the undo manager after successful save.

      • onSavePngFileAs

        boolean onSavePngFileAs()
        Shows a save dialog to the user and starts a png sequence save.
        Returns:
        True if the saving has been started. False if the user cancelled it.

      • onSaveFile

        boolean onSaveFile()
        Saves the current png sequence if there is already a known file. If not then the file needs to be saved with user interaction.
        Returns:
        True if the save process has not been cancelled by the user.

      • onSavePngFileAs

        boolean onSavePngFileAs(javafx.scene.image.Image image,
                        java.lang.String strNameProposed)
        Shows a save dialog to the user and starts saving a single image from FramePane under a separate filename.
        Parameters:
        image - An object of type Image.
        strNameProposed - A string with a proposed filename.
        Returns:
        True if the saving has been started. False if the user cancelled it.

      • validateProject

        boolean validateProject(PngProject project)
        Validates a loaded PngProject for usability. Informs the user with a message box if there is a problem.
        Parameters:
        project - A PngProject.
        Returns:
        True if the PngProject has been successfully validated.

      • openProjectFile

        void openProjectFile(java.io.File file)
        Starts a Progress task to open a given project file and returns. The Progress task opens and loads the project autonomously in a GUI independent thread. If an error occurs then the user will be informed with a message box.
        Parameters:
        file - The File to open.

      • openPngFiles

        public void openPngFiles(java.io.File[] afiles,
                         javafx.event.EventHandler<ValueEvent<Bitmap32Sequence>> receiveHandler)
        Starts a Progress task to open a given png file or a series of png files and returns. The Progress task opens and loads each file autonomously in a GUI independent thread. If a png file is completely loaded then a receive handler will be invoked for handover. If an error occurs then the user will be informed with a message box. 
         See also ValueEvent.
        Parameters:
        afiles - An array of File objects to open.
        receiveHandler - An object of type EventHandler.

      • fileOpenDialog

        java.io.File[] fileOpenDialog(java.lang.String strTitle,
                              boolean bMultiple,
                              javafx.stage.FileChooser.ExtensionFilter... aFilters)
        Shows a file open dialog to the user.
        Parameters:
        strTitle - A string with a localizable title id.
        bMultiple - True if the user can choose multiple files.
        aFilters - A variable arguments list of FileChooser.ExtensionFilter objects.
        Returns:
        An array of File object(s) or null if the user cancelled the operation.

      • onFileOpen

        void onFileOpen(boolean bMultiple)
        Begins a file open process with user interaction. This method prepares one or more ExtensionFilter objects to be passed to a file open dialog. Then it starts the dialog and the user may choose one or more files or can cancel the process. If not cancelled then the file(s) will be loaded.
        Parameters:
        bMultiple - If true then only one or more png file(s) can be loaded. If false then only one file can be loaded, either a png or a project file.

      • onSingleBitmapOpen

        boolean onSingleBitmapOpen(javafx.event.EventHandler<ValueEvent<Bitmap32>> handler)
        Reads a single Bitmap32 object using the file open chain. 
         See also ValueEvent.
        Parameters:
        handler - An object of type EventHandler.
        Returns:
        True if the opening process started. False if the user cancelled it.

      • onSingleImageOpen

        public boolean onSingleImageOpen(javafx.event.EventHandler<ValueEvent<javafx.scene.image.Image>> handler)
        Reads a single Image object using the file open chain. 
         See also ValueEvent.
        Parameters:
        handler - An object of type EventHandler.
        Returns:
        True if the opening process started. False if the user cancelled it.
